title: [Large-scale] Strategic Shifts in Emergency Remote Education Design Using Online LMS

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital device usage proficiency (smartphone utilization)
context.additional_context: Analyzing changes in learning design based on experiences transitioning from offline-centered education to LMS-based emergency remote learning. Requires design considerations for learners' limited technological access and socio-curricular characteristics.

learning_goals: Learners can complete 80% or more of a lesson design utilizing LMS basic functions (assignments, discussion boards, content uploads).

Learners create a design plan converting three face-to-face learning activities (e.g., discussion, presentation, group projects) into LMS digital activities (quizzes, surveys, video lectures). They achieve an average of 4+ points on peer evaluation and instructor feedback rubrics (5-point scale).
Propose three or more LMS utilization strategies that enhance accessibility considering learners' technological environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
